frame.name: Rotting
frame.definition: <def-root>In this frame a <fen>Patient</fen>, which is an organic substance, undergoes the natural process of decaying from an <fen>Initial_state</fen> to a <fen>Result</fen>. <ex><fex name="Patient">The leaves</fex> <t>rotted</t> <fex name="Result">into a mass of slime</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The dresses</fex> <t>decayed</t> <fex name="I_state">from their former beauty</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Patient
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change. <ex><fex name="Patient">The leaves</fex> <t>rotted</t> into a mass of slime.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The dresses</fex> <t>decayed</t> from their former beauty.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is where the rotting occurs.
<ex>Any traces of uneaten food will <t>decompose</t> <fex name="Place">in your tank</fex> and foul the water.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> indicates when the rotting occurs.
<ex><fex name="Time">Before he could get to the specimen</fex> , its entrails had <t>decomposed</t> so badly that they had to be thrown away.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> indicates the reason for which the <fen>Patient</fen> rots. <ex>Typically, the front top six teeth will <t>decay</t> <fex name="Explanation">because of the way the child has sucked on its bottle</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> is the result of the change of phase of the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>The leaves <t>rotted</t> <fex name="Result">into a mass of slime</fex>.</ex> <ex>A dead snail <t>decomposes</t> very rapidly, <fex name="Result">fouling the water badly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Initial_state
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Initial_state</fen> is the original state of the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>The dresses <t>decayed</t> <fex name="I_state">from their former beauty</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Duration</fen> indicates the amount of time for which the <fen>Patient</fen> rots. <ex>That thorn had been there , <t>festering</t>, <fex name="Dur">for months</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speed
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> is the rate at which the <fen>Patient</fen> changes. <ex>A dead snail <t>decomposes</t> <fex name="Spd">very rapidly</fex>, fouling the water badly.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> describes which part of a larger whole is being affected.
<ex>The cloth was <t>rotting</t> <fex name="sub">around the edges</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> expressions that indicate to what degree the <fen>Patient</fen> has changed. <ex> Its entrails had <fex name="Degree">totally</fex> <t>decomposed</t>.</ex> <ex>Before he could get to the specimen , its entrails had <t>decomposed</t> <fex name="Deg">so badly that they had to be thrown away</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number of times that a rotting event takes place.
<ex><fex name="Frequency">Often</fex>, the food would <t>perish</t> because there was no refrigeration.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the Rotting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (horribly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
<ex>The soldiers' wounds <t>festered</t> <fex name="Manner">slowly</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that entails the <fen>Patient</fen> decaying. <ex>And I've got a piece of ham that 'll <t>spoil</t> <fex name="cir">if we don't eat it tonight</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: putrefy.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: decay or rot and produce a fetid smell.

lexUnit.name: rot.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: decompose by the action of bacteria and fungi; decay or cause to decay

lexUnit.name: decompose.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of organic matter) decay; become rotten.

lexUnit.name: decay.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: rot or cause to rot through the action of bacteria and fungi; decompose.

lexUnit.name: spoil.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of food) become unfit for eating.

lexUnit.name: decay.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state or process of decaying.
